page.title: 16 PENHILL FARM - CALNE
page.content: Mr. Bell was trained at Lackham College because he was interested in sheep. He saw some demonstrations of sheep milking in a farm in Dorset and thought it would be good to try it at his farm. His father agreed to let him try.He started with 32 Friesland sheep in the autumn of 1982. Friesland sheep were chosen because this breed has high milk yield and also a fine fleece which makes very good soft wool.There has been a lot of research done at Great Ormond Street Hospital into the benefits of sheep milk for babies.It is high in proteins. It is also good for people who have allergies or asthma.It tastes very good.Milk from the sheep is collected in the same way as from cows except that the machine is smaller and quicker,a cow sucks 60 times a minute a sheep 120 .
